InterviewsAn interview is an important conversation to learn about someone | 'What's it like being...', this interview is about, want to know more about | The job went to... When you interview someone, you ask them questions to learn about them. We often talk about what an interview is like, for example, we say 'interviews can be stressful'. If you talk about this interview, it's something on TV you watched. Say 'This interview was about...', this interview is about ...'. You talk about who got the job after an interview. Saying The job went to... means the company chose kim. What can we say instead of 'frequently' when we're talking?Kia ora ThomasThere are a few different ways you could say this. One basic way is to say 'often'. You could also use the word 'regularly':I often miss the bus. He cares about people and the environment.I regularly play football. She is interested in philosophy. You don't have to include 'often' or 'regularly' if you have already said when you or your character normally do something.  Converting stories into personal experiences (B2):Turn a short story into something that has happened to you.
One day, I went with my friends to a cool adventure park. It was a sunny day and we had lots of fun. We did lots of different fun things and they were all so exciting! It was a really fun day.

(NAME): It can be very expensive but it is so much fun. 
(NAME): It's the best day of the year! 
(NAME): It was the best time, I hope there is another one soon. 
 Focus on language (B2):

* When you give some information, say "it costs" (coÃ»te) and not "it is expensive" (c'est cher).

* Look at how someone else has spoken and use a different way.

Written communication is a big part of most office jobs

Here are some points to be aware of:
Introducing yourself and others - Hello, I'm Frank. Nice to meet you. I'm Emily. And these are my colleagues alex, harry and adrian.
Complaining politely - Sorry, I can't hear you. Could you speak up (or speak more slowly)? I'm afraid I didn't catch that / I didn't understand. What did you say?
Using phone and email - Thanks for calling. If you want to follow up this email, please call. I'll be in the office all week, here is my number if you need to speak to me.
Asking questions - May I interrupt? I'm sorry to be late, did I miss anything? How much is this? When can I expect it?
Understanding people - Sounds good / that sounds fine. OK, that's fine by me. I see / I understand what you mean. Oh, I didn't know that.
Reading advice - Never write in capitals. Try to be brief but exact. Be polite if it's someone's fault. Learn how to say things politely.
Watch out for 
*? : You can pause, catch your breath or think a bit before asking for more information.// : You can reply with a short answer and continue the conversation after. E.g. yes /// oh OK 
+ : You can say "yes" or "mmm". Then you can continue the conversation after. E.g. Pun talk ah // no thanks -- please come again // last week 
- : When you are upset or angry, you can interrupt someone or wave your hand to stop them talking. Or, you can just sit there without saying anything.// When you are pretending you do not understand something to be kind or funny, you can finish off with a mmm. Can I have a glass of water // um

French B1 Example Conversation

I read that French engine oil can clog your engine. Ooh that doesn't sound good. I hope we're driving diesel. It's better for the car and better for babies! If you drive a petrol vehicle on petrol, you need to change your engine more often as well. Diesel engines, also known as compression-ignition engines, ignite fuel using compression. I rebelled against my parents by buying a gas guzzling car and liking pop music. Diesel is better for your budget and for the planet. Oh, wow epic. When you breathe in diesel fumes, it's bad for you. Does diesel make car smell better? I bought a small car so my family could fit inside and I would save money on petrol. Diesel makes your engine smell worse. You might even have to pay a fine for the terrible pollution you're causing.

French B2 Example Conversation

My favourite French actress came from a poor background. I wonder if that's the reason she worked so hard? Do rich people in France go out less often? Apollonia is an arty actress who refuses to do Hollywood sex scenes. They have time to party as well as pay for chores. Some of the more famous ones are incredibly rich. The wealthiest are royalty. I can't think of a more glamorous career. Movie stars must make quite a lot of money.

French advanced Example Conversation

I've always wanted to be an actor but you have to work really hard. While some actors remain very humble, some start to change over time. It's not easy to look good under intense movie lights.

Vous devez donner ['la] vaccin a...Writer's opinion: [Finir] C'est [vraiment] mal.April 2020Robin Nielsen Robin Nielsen is a French comedian who lives in the United States. He is an expert in communication and has already travelled around the world with his team. He recently gave a video interview to Damien, a French businessman who also has Spanish roots. In the video, Damien told Robin about a new situation in his company caused by the Coronavirus crisis. All employers in his country must now tell their workers to work from home according to the French government because too many people are getting sick. Robin asked him:"What's the role of your employees in the situation?""The most important task is to take care of yourself and make sure the family is protected. Employees have to follow the rules and don't go to the office on particular days."Damien told Robin that the biggest problem for his company was how to organize such a big change and make sure people are not too stressed. Robin disagreed and did not see it that way. He said that the crisis is a good opportunity for executives to become better leaders and the team has to support each other. He also said that if a solution is not found, his company will be too weak to succeed in twenty years because computers will become much more powerful. Finally, Robin told Damien to be positive and remember that the small actions people take today will increase success later on.

Q: Give a sentence with 'extrapolate'
A: Extrapolating from historic weather data, in March there is a 60% chance of sunshine.
(Always?) Use: a verb + from + (some things), then Y, with chance of something.

Q: Predict the future using 'extrapolate'
A: We can (kind-of) predict the future because, based on what happened in the past, it is likely it will continue in a similar way.

Q: Can you explain 'bear'
A: (1) To support or hold up; (2) To undergo the weight or pressure of; (3) To hold or keep; (4) Used in some expressions like "bear a grudge" to mean "carry". (5) To endure without complaint or fear
(A)

Q: Give a sentence using 'bear'
A: I can't bear this all the time. (Can I have a break?)

Q: Synonyms for 'bear'; put up with
A: 'Put up with, bear or endure'

Q: Put in order to make natural for B2 - Explain that some people think...
A: Different people have different opinions: some people think the museum should be free, and others object to it, saying it would be too expensive to run.

Q: Describe a film that has 'plot'
A: (A) The planned sequence of events in a work of fiction, including what happens and how the story ends
The story is about two friends who decide to go into space in an old rocket and end up on a different planet, where there are robots, dinosaurs and lots of adventures. There is a bit where a bird steals the food but they release it back into the sky and it flies away, and another shocking moment when a dinosaur gets hit by a net but flies away in the end. We saw it at the cinema and it was very good.
(B) The..
...story and / or organisation of a play, film, or book that helps the audience / reader understand it and enjoy it
The plot is a bit like a video game, with a beginning, middle and end - and it's a bit like Indiana Jones with a hero who is brave and a girl whose name is Kayla and they fight together to survive against the evil alien space guys. The music and actions and lights all lead you to know when to laugh, and when to be excited and not scared. There are some bad parts with people shouting, but when it comes back to active music and fighting we know it's still ok.

A: She was so happy, she started jumping and crying and laughing. (so...) + verb -ing

Q: Give ideas on how to organise a talk
A: So...you can introduce yourself, and think about the audience, and think about an ending, that brings it all together and you can talk a little about the end, to finish well. 15 min (Harder)

We're only a few days out from the US midterms, and the Democratic Party is divided on many issues. To understand who's in office and who's not, the Voters Not Politicians turnout toolkit is a good place to start. The state of Michigan is represented in the US Congress by 9 Republicans, 7 Democrats and 1 Libertarian. As many as 10 or 11 of those seats are competitive, depending on how you count.

I would like to point out that in many popular culture depictions of Midterms, thereâ€™s a clear evil party and a good party. Thereâ€™s some truth to it, but stats only tell us so much. two things people do not know how to say in English.
"Quoi?" is the question "What?" and "Quelle?" is the question "Which?".
In English, there are multiple ways to ask "What?". For example:
What is that?
What's that?
What is this?
In the flipped classroom video lesson that follows, I'll teach you exactly how to say these things in French.

Quelqu'un qui n'avait rien dans mon coeur lorsque nous n'Ã©tions pas ensemble aurait pu penser que j'Ã©tais un sÃ©ducteur froid, pas trop douÃ© avec le coeur et qui ne savait pas trop comment Ãªtre avec les filles ; et quelqu'un qui m'aurait vu avec elle aurait pu croire que j'Ã©tais un amant qui a tout le temps envie de lui et qui est trÃ¨s timide.	before reading the textSome people think that they can tell whether you love someone or not just by seeing you walk with them. I don't think that's true though. "There are many ways in which you can love people, " I would say. After all, you could spend a lot of time worrying about a friend who is in trouble, but the look on their face when they need you next to them is probably not the same as when you would be in love.
fewerI only really care for people who I spend a lot of time with, but I have never thought of any friend as someone I could love. I think I've thought about it this time though, but I'm not going to tell. I guess I could go on a secret date with this girl who smiled at me, but I don't know what would happen if everyone she knows found out.The last things I would want would be to be seen as a creep or to have to stop seeing her. I'm just not ready for a relationship.
I could be feeling completely different a few weeks from now though. I'll just have to wait and see what happens then. after reading the textSome people believe that people only show their true feelings when they are with people they love. I don't believe this, though. You can show people how you feel about them in different ways, and you may not even know it. For example, when you are worried about one of your best friends, you may spend a long time thinking about them. This could show that you care about them. The expression on their face when they need you to be with them would probably show their love. But it might not be how they look when you don't think about them, or when you are with a new person you like.
I wouldn't call any of my friends the people I really love, but I think that I might feel different about someone now. I would like to take her out somewhere quiet and talk while no one else is around. But I don't know what would happen if I told anyone we go out together. She might think I'm some sort of silly romantic person who is desperate for a girlfriend. I wouldn't want that, and I don't think that she likes me that way, so I would just have to stop seeing her.She might feel the same, or she might start dating me. We'll just have to wait and see. Figuring out what to say when you say the opposite of what you mean You don't always say exactly the same words when you are talking in English or French. You can leave words out sometimes or put them in when they aren't really needed. However, when you leave words out, you have to make new words up to show your meaning. Mots inutiles You often don't need to say certain words because they are easy to understand from what you say before or after. You don't need to tell people the name of something they can see. You can just say what it is. You can use your hand to show the name of something if you don't know its French. We
